isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - NOZZLES - REASSEMBLY

step1.para:
1.
DO NOT touch lapped surfaces. To avoid interchanging of nozzle parts, reassemble one nozzle at a time.
Dip all parts in clean calibrating fluid.
Clamp the nozzle holder body upright in a vise, using the flats on the holder body to clamp onto.
Select an appropriate size spacer to achieve the correct opening pressure and insert it into the holder body.
Place the pressure adjusting spring and spring seat guide into the nozzle holder body.
Align the valve stop spacer with the dowel pin holes in the holder body and assemble to the nozzle holder body.
Dip the nozzle valve, located in the nozzle valve body, into clean calibrating fluid. Insert the nozzle valve into the valve body and move the valve up and down several times to insure free movement.

Apply a thin, even coat of "Lubriplate 630-AAA" or equivalent to the nozzle valve body seating shoulder; align the nozzle valve body locating pin holes with the plate pins and assemble to the two components.
Assemble the cap nut over the nozzle valve body and tighten the cap by hand to the holder.
Assemble nozzle holder assembly to injection nozzle holding fixture SE-2752 as described under "DISASSEMBLY" in this section.
Tighten the cap nut to the specified special torque.
Install a new copper gasket over the nozzle tip.
Cap the nozzles with plastic caps until retesting and adjusting is performed.
